good
morning resolution honoring The Life and
Legacy of Tina Nicole Carter ABD from
the office of Mississippi Public Service
commissioner thether stamps whereas the
Mississippi Public Service Commission
deeply Mourns the untimely passing of
Miss Tina Nicole Carter ABD a dedicated
and accomplished employee who tragically
departed this life on November 16th
2024 and whereas Tina Nicole Carter was
born born on March 30th 1989 in Jackson
Mississippi as the youngest of three
children to Julius and Robbie Carter she
excelled academically graduating as
valer Victorian of Forest Hill High
School in 2007 her pursuit of Excellence
continued as she earned a bachelor of of
Business Administration from alorn State
University in 2011 two master's degrees
from Jackson State University and
Business Administration in
2013 and public accountancy in 2020 and
was nearing completion of her Doctorate
of philosophy in Business Administration
and whereas Miss Carter dedicated her
professional life to Public Service
First as a child support enforcement
officer for the Mississippi Department
of Human Services and since 2017 as the
vision director for the Mississippi
Public Service Commission where she
worked tirelessly to uphold the values
of Integrity service and commitment and
whereas Tina Nicole Carter's love of
people her Devotion to her family and
her commitment to Excellence touched all
who had the privilege of knowing her she
leaves behind a legacy of service
kindness and Leadership through her
roles in armentine chapter 7 daughter of
Risa and Zeta F beta sority Incorporated
that will continue to inspire those who
knew her and whose lives she impacted
and whereas her life was defined by
faith family and service Zena accepted
Christ at an early age and was a devoted
member of Bertha Chapel MB Church Tina
is lovingly remembered and deeply
cherished by her parents Julius and
Robbie Carter her children Jordan and
jayen and her siblings Julius Jr and
Crystal her nieces nephews extended
family and a wide circle of friends and
colleagues all of whom will forever
treasure her memory now therefore be it
resolved that the Mississippi Public
Service Commission and commissioner the
stamps do hereby honor and celebrate the
life achievements and memory of Miss
Tina Carter ABD her Legacy of public
service and dedication to Excellence
will remain a Guiding Light to those she
served and inspired be it further
resolve that a copy of this resolution
be provided to the Carter family and
entered into the official records of the
Mississippi Public Service Commission to
commemorate the enduring contributions
of Miss Tina Nicole Carter to the
commission and to the people of Miss

Mr chairman Commissioners on September
Force fire filed his annual rate
stabilization adjustment writer RSA for
the 12 months ended June 30th of
2024 the RSA is calculated annually
based on spire's books and records for
the most recent 12 month period perod
ending June 30 based on this information
it is determined whether the company's
Revenue should be increased decreased or
left unchanged spire's initial filing
called for a rate increase of
approximately 850,000 the main driver of
the rate increase this year is
investment in infrastructure
improvements based on the requested
Revenue requirement an average
residential customer would have seen a
bill increase of approximately
$163 per month this this was based on
spur filed allowed return on Equity of
10.54% a rate base of approximately 53.3
million and a calculated an income of
1.96 million for the test
year staff recommended several
adjustments which decreased the applied
rate Base by approximately
94,000 staff also recommended
adjustments to both spire's Revenue
calculations and its expenses which
would result in an increase in the
calculated net income for the the test
Year by 279,000 the net effect of these
adjustments reduced the overall rate
increase from approximately 850,000
requested to 566,000 which results in a
33% reduction in the requested rate
increase Spar has agreed to staff's
recommended adjustments as a result of
these agreed changes the implementation
of the 2024 RSA will result in an
increase of $19 in an average
residential monthly bill which is 54
cents less than sp's original request
the rate will take effect in January of
2025 the staff recommends
approval thank you for your presentation
and um and again thank you for the the
staff's work and working with us pre
doet to make sure we understand what all
is going on so
um you heard our explanation are there
any questions
hearing none do I have a motion so move
second all all in favor say I I any
opposed motion carries we'll move on to
um item number two docket number 2024
ua42 um M Mike you're recognized to

Commissioners on April 25th centero
energy and Delta utilities Mississippi
LLC f a joint application seeking
commission approval for proposed
transaction and related certific a
public convenience public convenience
and necessity wherein Center Point will
sell and delta Mississippi will acquire
certain public utility natural gas
assets of Centerpoint the transaction
will result in delta Mississippi owning
and operating Center Point's natural gas
business in Mississippi and serving
approximately 135,000
customers as part of the transaction
delta Mississippi plans to retain Center
Point's current employees and will
assume Center Point's current rates and
tariffs
and Center Point will assist Delton
Mississippi with his operation of the
gas system under a transition agreement
for a period of time until delta
Mississippi can stand up its own
technology platform and share service
affiliate delta Mississippi is not
seeking an acquisition adjustment or
recovery of transaction cost however
delta Mississippi is seeking recovery of
all transition
cost on November 25th staff Center Point
in delta Mississippi entered into a
joint stipulation that includes several
key terms and conditions for the
transaction including the following
delta Mississippi will assume and adopt
Center points terms and conditions of
service as well as its rates and rate
schedules this includes terms governing
Delta Mississippi's allowed returnal
equity and capital structure which will
be fixed until the commission has the
opportunity to set Delta Mississippi's
rates in a rate case delta Mississippi
will has committed not to file a general
rate case sooner than approximately 33
months after the closing of the
transaction in addition Delta has
committed to providing forecasted
Capital costs and om&m expenses and to
report to the commission if any of its
capital costs are anticipated to be 15%
more than forecast or the omm expenses
are anticipated to be 10% more than
forecast these Provisions are intended
to maintain consistency in rates for for
a period of approximately 3 years
following the close of the
transaction all transition cost
associated with the change of control
from Center Point to delta Mississippi
will be deferred and
booked through a regulatory asset that
the commission will approve for
accounting purposes only and delta
Mississippi is required to report on all
transition costs and expenses it will
defer to the regulatory asset and
ultimately seek
recovery The Joint stipulation makes
clear that recovery of these cost if any
will be determined by the Commission in
the future rate case delta Mississippi
committed to and the joint stipulation
confirms that customer rates will not
reflect any acquisition premium
resulting from the transaction with
these important conditions in place
staff believes that the transaction
meets the public interest requirements
of the statute and therefore staff
recommends approval of the joint
stipulation thank you for your
